# Schedule

## September 12 (Thu)

**Session 1 (9.00-11.30  / 2.5 hours): Standard bioinformatics workflow in microbiome research**

 * Introduction and learning goals
 * Overview of a standard bioinformatics workflow
 * Reproducible research and best practices in microbiome data science
 

**Session 2 (12-13 / 1 hour)**

 * Lecture: Contemporary research in microbiome data science
 
**Lunch (13-14:30 / 1.5 hours)**


**Session 3 (14.30-17.30 / 3 hours including breaks) / Hands-on 1: introduction to R tools**

 * Part I:   Reproducible reporting with Rmarkdown 
 * Part II:  Phyloseq data structure
 * Part III: Data manipulation and exploration


## September 13 (Fri)

**Session 4 (9.00-12:00 / 3 hours): Key concepts and techniques: mixed lecture and hands-on**

**Lunch 12:00-13:30 (1.5 hours)**

 * Completing the assignments

**Session 6 (15:30-17:00 / 1.5 hours): Wrap-up**

 * Summary and reflection of the leaning objects
